vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The search functionality at `/search-safe` was previously vulnerable to Reflected XSS via the `q` parameter. A fix was applied using HTML escaping.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to the safe search page
2. Try the XSS payload:
   ```
   /search-safe?q=<script>alert(document.domain)</script>
   ```
3. Check if the payload is reflected unescaped in the response

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /search-safe?q=<script>alert(document.domain)</script> HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
```

Expected fixed behavior: The response should contain `<script>alert(document.domain)</script>` instead of raw HTML tags.

## Impact
If the fix is proper, the XSS payload should be HTML-encoded and not execute.
